login_to_duplicate: You need to be logged in to duplicate a sheet.
public_sheet_tooltip: Public sheet, everyone can see it
private_sheet_tooltip: Private sheet, only you and assigned groups can see it
cannot_delete_sheet_in_group: You cannot delete a sheet that is assigned to a group
delete_sheet_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this sheet?
delete_group_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this group?
leave_group_confirm: Are you sure you want to leave this group?
cannot_unassign_gm_sheet: Cannot unassign a GM sheet as long as the group exists
delete_account_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete your account?
account_name_hint: The account name is only used for login and is not publicly visible.
no_groups: You are not part of any group yet. Create or join one to get started!
empty_custom_entries_will_be_deleted: Empty custom entries will be deleted
register_hint: This Page is still in development. Password-/Account-Recovery is not implemented yet! Store your password in a safe place.
howto_text_create_sheet:
In this guided Tour you will learn how to create a Sheet. A Sheet is a collection of Contents with limits You can create sheets to share your limits or form a group to construct a consent from all sheets.

 *You need to be logged in to take this Tour.*
howto_text_share_sheet:
In this short tour, you will learn how to share a sheet publicly and see what the sheet will look like for others.

 *You must be logged in and have already created a sheet to take this tour*
howto_text_create_group:
The great strength of this tool is the ability to find a consensus for all content with many different boundaries. In this tour I will show you how to create a group, add or remove others and where you can see the consensus of the group. 

 *You must be logged in to take this tour*
howto_text_join_group:
Here you can find out how to join a group and how to see the consensus of the group. I also explain how to assign a sheet to a group. 

 *You must be logged in to take this tour*
tour_create_sheet_sheet_grid:
Here you can see your sheets. Click on 'Details' to view and edit them.

 The icon next to the name of the sheet indicates whether the sheet is shared publicly (green globe) or can only be viewed by you or as part of a consent of a group.
tour_create_sheet_new_sheet_button:
This button allows you to create additional sheets. 

 If you continue clicking here, a new sheet will also be created
tour_create_sheet_consent_legend_grid: Here you can see once again the meaning of the Consent limits explained
tour_create_sheet_edit_tab:
In this view, you will see content that is relevant to borders for many people. However, this list can never be complete. So if you are missing content, you can: 

* Use the `ADD CONTENT` button to create your own entry that only exists for this sheet (and assigned groups) or 
* Switch to `Contents` in the navigation and send me a suggestion at the bottom of the page so that I can add the content for everyone.

 New content is initially added as Unkown border.
tour_create_sheet_display_tab:
This view shows you your sheet. 

If you have shared your sheet, you will find a shareable link and a QR code for this link above the content.
tour_create_sheet_ordered_topics_tab: Here, the content has been sorted according to the limits. In addition, the limits have been prioritized so that hard limits are displayed first, then uncertainties and only lastly consent to certain content. This makes it possible to see immediately which hard limits are set in the sheet.
tour_create_sheet_groups_tab: Here you can see all the groups you have already joined or created. You can add this sheet to the group's consensus by ticking the box.
tour_create_sheet_sheet_editor:
Remember to give the sheet a name so that you can recognize it.You can also add a general comment that will be displayed on your sheet. **IMPORTANT** If you share your sheet publicly, this comment will also be public. 

 You can set limits for all content in this category using the content supercategories. **IMPORTANT** You can only use the category to influence limits that are currently set to 'Unknown'. 

For each content, a text field can be expanded via the check mark to add comments to the content for you. **IMPORTANT** These annotations are displayed in the consent and also publicly (if the sheet is public). So be careful what information you enter. Within a group consent, only the content of the annotation is displayed, not the name of the sheet or of you.
tour_create_sheet_create_group_from_shee:
With this button you can create a new group that has this sheet as a GM sheet. 

GM sheets can only be deleted once their group(s) have been deleted. 

 GM sheets form the basis of the console
